project.name: LDAPd Server Backend Database SPI
project.shortDescription: Server backend database service provider interfaces for implementors.
project.description: The LDAP Server can have many different kinds of Backends. Backends intern may use any kind of storage mechanism and search mechanism. A special custom designed B+Tree backed file database is used for the default and system backends. The custom database strives to be flexible with the kind of underlying backing store used to build tables and indices on entry attributes. An SPI is defined to make the underlying storage structures swappable. So implementations like unix dbm, ndbm, Sleepycat's bdb (a.k.a. Berkeley DB), and Alex Boisvert's jdbm can be swapped in and out.
